articles.author: Sean Hollister
articles.title: We asked LG for a burn-in warranty on its OLED monitor — and it’s delivering
articles.description: LG Electronics now has a two-year burn-in warranty for its LG 27GR95QE-B OLED monitor, Christopher De Maria, LG’s head of consumer PR for North America, tells The Verge.
articles.content:
We asked LG for a burn-in warranty on its OLED monitor and its delivering
We asked LG for a burn-in warranty on its OLED monitor and its delivering
 / After four months of asking, LG says burn-in d… [+4328 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
She writes that Dell saw it as an opportunity to “further differentiate Alienware from its competitors.”

Dough claims it will offer a two-year burn-in warranty, too.I would still argue that two or even three years of burn-in protection isn’t necessarily enough for a device you could easily use for a decade — but going from a zero-year guarantee to a two-year one is a big move for LG.RelatedLG’s 27-inch OLED is ushering in a new age for monitors

But after four months of conversations with The Verge, LG Electronics has changed that warranty.Technically, it says LG will only cover “normal and proper use” and specifically excludes “Damage or failure of the Product resulting from misuse [or] abuse.”

But LG Electronics product marketing director David Park makes it pretty clear: “Now, as long as you use the monitor as intended (personal PC monitor) in a residential setting (does not support commercial usage like retail signage display) burn-in is covered.”

“Normal use means the product is used for what it was created to do.Asus gaming PR lead Cat Tompkins said the company would need to talk to LG about its burn-in warranty before providing an official statement for this story.For years, OLED enthusiasts and monitor manufacturers have warned that you shouldn’t leave the same content on the screen for too long, some even going so far as to hide the Windows taskbar and browser chrome to avoid burn-in.Alienware currently offers large curved ultrawide QD-OLED screens from Samsung.Corsair uses the same LG Display screen, while Alienware uses a Samsung QD-OLED panel.In my recent review of LG’s 27-inch OLED desktop gaming monitor, I wrote how the company’s warranty explicitly excludes “burned-in images resulting from improper usage.” And when I reached out to clarify, I couldn’t get a straight answer about burn-in coverage from the company.OLED might be the future of monitors, but first, they need to finish addressing burn-in fears.LG now has a two-year burn-in warranty for its OLED gaming monitor in the US, Christopher De Maria, LG’s head of consumer PR for North America, tells The Verge.So confident that they offer a burn-in warranty to monitor manufacturers — some of which don’t pass along that warranty to you.But LG Display and Samsung Display, the companies that make the OLED panels inside these monitors, now have so many built-in protections and manage their brightness so much that they’re confident they can stave off burn-in for quite some time.Photo by Becca Farsace / The Verge

“Our warranty is built around the fact that we trust in that pixel refresh function to help mitigate burn-in,” says Alienware PR specialist Frank Cestone.After we pointed that out to LG Electronics and published our skeptical but largely favorable review, the company finally confirmed it will cover burn-in.“Discretion” is not a guarantee

“While burn-in is not considered part of our formal 3-year monitor warranty coverage, in practice, our customer care team has discretion to assist customers with this rare issue and authorize repair services, free-of-charge,” says Acer media relations manager Erin Davern.The new warranty, which De Maria says also applies retroactively to any LG 27GR95QE-B monitors that have already been sold, doesn’t exactly spell it out that way.Page 2 of  LG Gaming OLED Monitor Warranty



    Contributed to DocumentCloud by The Verge (Vox.com) • View document or read text

That’s important because companies will often take evidence of damage as evidence of abuse, like how some companies will deny warranty service on water-resistant phones if any water penetrates inside.Photo by Sean Hollister / The Verge

Acer and Asus, which also sell monitors with the same LG Display panel, still don’t cover burn-in.In this case that is gaming (professional and casual) as well as desktop computing such as Windows, etc,” De Maria tells The Verge.Neither answered our question about why they don’t pass along LG Display’s burn-in warranty to their own customers, with the Acer Predator X27U and the Asus ROG Swift OLED PG27AQDM.Another image of LG’s 27-inch gaming OLED.“When QD-OLED technology was introduced, we knew there was an opportunity to address the broader concerns around OLED reliability,” Dell VP of display technologies Yoon Lee tells The Verge.Dell’s Alienware and Corsair both sell OLED monitors with three-year burn-in warranties, and Alienware even offers next-business-day replacement.

The next Final Fantasy VII mobile game launches next month

 / Final Fantasy VII Ever Crisis finally has a release date.
ByJay Peters, a n… [+1519 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content: Square Enix first announced Ever Crisis in 2021.That same day, the company revealed an FFVII prequel / mobile battle royale that was released in 2021 and shut down in January.But Remake worked better than I expected (and Rebirth looks promising), so maybe Ever Crisis will stick the landing, too.Ever Crisis’ art style takes inspiration from the original PlayStation release’s blocky characters but updates it so that Cloud actually has hands.Ever Crisis’ marketing also features the tagline “another possibility for a remake,” which seems to indicate that the game might offer yet another deviation from the original game’s timeline.I think it looks quite charming, and it’s one of the reasons I want to play the game for myself.Final Fantasy VII Ever Crisis, a new game in the FFVII universe, will be released on iOS and Android on September 7th.I’m a bit skeptical about that, given that Square Enix is already juggling quite a bit of new story in Final Fantasy VII Remake.The game brings together moments from other FFVII titles, adds some new ones, and will let you “experience the journey of a young hero Sephiroth.” You can preorder it on the App Store and preregister for it on Google Play right now ahead of the official launch.

articles.author: Victoria Song
articles.title: Multifunctional smartwatch bands should be more of a thing
articles.description: Using Nomad’s glow-in-the-dark Apple Watch strap and Samsung’s new hybrid eco-leather strap for the Galaxy Watch 6 has me yearning for multifunctional smartwatch bands.
articles.content:
Multifunctional smartwatch bands should be more of a thing
Multifunctional smartwatch bands should be more of a thing
 / While swapping out bands isnt quite as difficult these days, straps that can… [+4936 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
The more mileage you can get out of one strap, the less you need in your collection, and you’d have less of a need to swap them out for specific occasions.The last thing I want is to add more steps before I can head out the door.This is specific to me, but I’ve already got to slather on sunscreen, stick in my contact lenses, get my water bottle, and sync up at least three other wearables for testing.My dream strap would be some kind of leather up top, with a more breathable nylon or fabric underside.There are tools you can buy to make the process easier, but then you’ve also got to dig out the tools whenever you feel like switching up your style.It’s more of a Slimer, ectoplasm-y green.You can find much more affordable alternatives on Amazon or Etsy, but having to replace any part of a collection is an annoying prospect, regardless of cost.Straps that use standard pins are convenient in that many smartwatches and mechanical watches use them.I’ve got bad eyes and a penchant for manicures.It’d be neat, if like Nomad’s glow-in-the-dark strap, you could have one that changes color depending on the light or body temperature — sort of like a mood ring.The “minimal effort” part is key.Smartwatch makers have gotten better about this over time, but sometimes straps aren’t backward- or forward-compatible.At the very least, multifunctional bands would let you save time and money, without sacrificing style for folks who may lack hand dexterity.Oftentimes, your existing straps may not work, and then you have a useless collection.I’m well aware this won’t appeal to everyone.Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The VergeButton mechanisms are much easier to use than standard pins, but I still broke my weak nails using this.Plenty of people like having a healthy strap collection, while others are happy to never switch from the default strap.At $60, Nomad’s strap is expensive, and if it didn’t feel like two straps in one, I’d balk at the idea of buying one in the first place — let alone having to toss it if it didn't work with my next Apple Watch.Watches — smart or otherwise — are a fashion statement, people have different needs from their wearables, and everybody’s skin reacts differently to certain materials.Button-based mechanisms — like Apple’s and Samsung’s new one-click straps— are less cumbersome but can still be difficult if you have limited hand mobility.If it’s the look that you’re going for, it can pass both up close and from a distance.Depending on how well the strap is made or the size of the mechanism itself, it can be a hassle to swap one strap for another.I’ve broken many a nail and chipped one too many manicures in the process.In most cases, it’s not difficult to swap out straps.But sometimes, it can be!But after trying out Nomad’s new glow-in-the-dark Apple Watch strap and Samsung’s hybrid eco-leather strap this week, I find myself yearning for straps that serve multiple purposes.Photo by Victoria Song / The Verge

In both cases, it’s similar to the “day-to-night” concept — an outfit or makeup look that’s easily adaptable from one scenario to another with minimal effort on the part of the wearer.This hybrid strap has eco-leather up top and more traditional fluoroelastomer rubber on the underside.RelatedApple Watch Ultra strap review: choose your fighter How to swap Pixel Watch bands

A more practical example would be the eco-leather strap that comes as the default on the Samsung Galaxy Watch 6.In the dark, it turns day-glo green.In normal lighting, all you see is a normal cream-colored strap.It’s the definition of business during the day, party at night.The hybrid aspect is that the underside of the strap is silicone.I’m a huge fan of this kind of strap because I don’t have to swap straps before a workout.I’ll admit it’s not the most practical strap — it’s a subtler glow in person, but it’s probably not the best pick if I were to go to a theater.Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The VergeButton mechanisms are much easier to use than standard pins, but I still broke my weak nails using this.Nomad’s strap launched earlier this week, and it’s as straightforward as you can get.Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge

This hybrid strap has eco-leather up top and more traditional fluoroelastomer rubber on the underside.Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge

The other issue is managing your strap collection.But the thing that spoke to me is it lets me switch up my style with next to no effort.Or, say you decide you want to go up or down a size within the same watch family.If every strap you buy can work in multiple scenarios, you don’t need as many straps to begin with.The easiest way to ensure you stick to an exercise regimen is to eliminate as much friction as you can from the process — and it’s a big reason why I don’t opt for leather straps in my day-to-day despite preferring the look.Never mind that eco-leather isn’t always real leather.It’s no surprise that most fitness trackers have swappable straps these days.(Silicone is nice, but my skin often breaks out in rashes from the contact; that never happens with fabric.)Considering how many knockoff leather hybrid straps there are and the fact Nomad’s glow-in-the-dark strap sold out in 24 hours, I don’t think I’m the only one who digs the idea.
articles.summary: silicone is nice but my skin often breaks out in rashes from the contact that never happens with fabric

articles.author: Emilia David
articles.title: Augie lets you make videos with an AI clone of your own voice
articles.description: The platform is aimed toward marketing teams to cut down on time making short videos and voice-overs.
articles.content:
Augie lets you make videos with an AI clone of your own voice
Augie lets you make videos with an AI clone of your own voice
 / Voice cloning helps do voice-overs without having to record them.
ByE… [+3055 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content: So another person in the same organization has to rerecord their spokesperson’s voice on their Augie account to clone their speech.After a deepfaked Drake song featuring an AI-generated version of the rapper’s voice went viral, it helped reignite concerns about copyright and illegally using someone’s else likeness.So, no putting your ex’s voice on speaker so you can fake a call with a weirdly helpful friend won’t work with Augie.Partnering with ElevenLabs, Aug X lets users record their or someone else’s voice and clone it to use for other short videos.Voice cloning is not new; Samsung even lets people use an AI voice to respond to calls, and now companies like Aug X are integrating the technology into more full-featured services.“We’ve pre-thought what could go wrong, so we’re being really careful about who can use the pre-recorded voice to clone,” Toeman says.The company is also working with its voice cloning partner ElevenLabs to identify AI-generated voices and videos.The Augie platform, aimed primarily toward marketers and social media teams, lets people quickly add narration, photos, text, and music to videos without needing to learn audio and video editing.Users cannot upload recordings, and the platform will only accept voices recorded with a live mic.That voice will then read the script with the tone, serious, enthusiastic, creepy, etc., which can be adjusted depending on the mood of the video.Jeremy Toeman, founder of Aug X, said the company wanted to add a voice cloning feature after realizing some people do not like speaking into a microphone or recording voice-overs.Users can also choose from a library of photos — Aug X licenses photos from Getty — or use AI-generated images to add to the video.He added that recorded voices, as opposed to the ones part of the larger Augie library, will only be available to individual accounts.For now, everyone using Augie has access to the voice cloning feature.Toeman says eventually, it might limit video length and quality and the number of cloned voices of non-paying subscribers because of the expense of running voice cloning servers with its partners.“You’d be surprised at the number of people who’ve used our voice cloning feature that came up to us and says thank you because they didn’t like recording narration,” he says.Augie went on public beta in May.Aug X released Augie, an AI-powered video creation platform incorporating a voice cloning feature to read ad copy without booking a recording studio.Toeman envisions marketing teams turning around short videos without the need to book their company spokesperson time in the recording studio.In a demo to The Verge, Toeman says users can either write or upload a script to Augie and then use a prerecorded voice (people need to record a short snippet of their voice saying anything) or choose one from its library.

articles.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
articles.title: Rival air taxi startups Wisk and Archer settle their trade secret theft lawsuit
articles.description: Wisk and Archer, rival air taxi startups, have settled their trade secrets lawsuit. Boeing, which owns Wisk, will take a small stake in Archer.
articles.content:
Rival air taxi startups Wisk and Archer settle their trade secret theft lawsuit
Rival air taxi startups Wisk and Archer settle their trade secret theft lawsuit
 / Wisk sued Archer in 2021, allegedl… [+3199 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
Wisk has said it hopes to launch an air taxi service within the next five years, at which point it predicts conducting 14 million flights annually in around 20 major markets around the globe.Wisk said it will become the exclusive provider of autonomous flying technology to Archer

“We are pleased to have reached a mutually agreeable settlement with Archer that resolves our concerns while also eliminating the need for a costly and distracting trial,” Wisk said in a statement.Image: Archer

Archer, based in Santa Clara, California, came out of stealth in spring 2020 after having poached key talent from Wisk and Airbus’ Vahana project.Wisk is committed to working collaboratively within the industry and leading in autonomous passenger flight.”

Wisk was formed in 2019 as a joint venture between Boeing and Kitty Hawk, the flying taxi company bankrolled by Google co-founder Larry Page that recently shut down.In addition to Wisk, companies like Joby Aviation, Volocopter, Ehang, and Archer have claimed they are on the cusp of launching services that will eventually scale up nationwide.A judge sent the lawsuit to trial in June, but now, the two sides have settled the dispute.Wisk and Archer, two leading air taxi startups, have settled their legal dispute over allegations of stolen trade secrets, avoiding a jury trial that would have cast a negative light on the emerging aviation technology sector.Boeing will invest in the private investment in public equity (PIPE) financing that Archer released today as part of its second quarter earnings report.Wisk said it will become the exclusive provider of autonomous flying technology to Archer, should Archer decide to pursue a self-flying aircraft.And Wisk will receive shares in Archer as part of Boeing’s investment in the company’s $215 million PIPE.Wisk accused Archer of misappropriating “thousands of highly confidential files containing very valuable trade secrets, as well as the use of significant innovations Wisk has patented.” Archer called the lawsuit “regrettable” and denied the allegations that the company had stolen Wisk’s intellectual property.The Mountain View, California-based company is in a race to become the first advanced air mobility company to get the green light from the FAA for passenger testing.Wisk, a wholly owned subsidiary of Boeing, sued Archer in 2021 for allegedly stealing its trade secrets and infringing on its patents.Air taxis, sometimes misidentified as “flying cars,” are essentially helicopters without the noisy, polluting gas motors (though they certainly have their own unique noise profile).Wisk’s aircraft, an all-electric four-seater, can fly without a human pilot and is the first electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) candidate for type certification.But in its lawsuit, Wisk argued that Archer didn’t just steal talent — it also stole trade secrets.

articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.title: Amazon is dropping dozens of in-house brands you didn’t even know it owned
articles.description: Amazon is getting rid of dozens of in-house clothing brands as it faces a potential antitrust lawsuit from the FTC, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal.
articles.content:
Amazon is dropping dozens of in-house brands you didnt even know it owned
Amazon is dropping dozens of in-house brands you didnt even know it owned
 / Amazon Basics is sticking around, but most oth… [+2303 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
However, this cutback will leave Amazon with just three in-house clothing brands: Amazon Essentials, Amazon Collection, and Amazon Aware.As of 2020, Amazon had 243,000 products for sale from over 45 different private-label brands.While Politico reported last month that the FTC is readying a lawsuit against the company, the WSJ says Amazon is expected to meet with the agency next week as a “last-rites meeting.”

Amazon’s private label products could still be a target of regulatory scrutiny, as the company was accused of leveraging third-party seller data to create in-house items that compete with other brands in 2020.The retail giant plans on cutting 27 of its 30 private-label clothing brands as it looks to cut costs and stave off antitrust scrutiny, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal.Sources close to the situation tell the WSJ that Amazon will continue to sell products from the now-discontinued brands until they run out.Last year, the WSJ reported that Amazon started scaling back the number of in-house products it sold to alleviate regulatory pressure.Over the years, Amazon has created dozens of private-label brands across a variety of departments, most of which operate without Amazon branding, such as Solimo, Wag, and Mama Bear.“We always make decisions based on what our customers want, and we’ve learned that customers seek out our biggest brands — like Amazon Basics and Amazon Essentials — for great value with high quality products at great price points,” Matt Taddy, vice president of Amazon Private Brands, tells The Verge in an emailed statement.Additionally, the WSJ notes that Amazon is ditching some private-label furniture brands as well, including Rivet and Stone & Beam.Taddy adds that the company is “thoughtful” about its private brand selection and that it will retire any items that “aren’t resonating with customers.”

Amazon’s decision to streamline its private label business comes amidst a possible antitrust lawsuit from the Federal Trade Commission.Amazon is slashing the number of in-house brands it offers on its marketplace.

articles.title: Russia heads to the Moon for the first time in 47 years
articles.description: Russia is heading back to the Moon as it tries to reassert itself as a significant world power in the wake of its war on Ukraine. A rocket carrying the Luna-25 craft will mark Russia’s first lunar mission since 1976. The expedition will attempt to land the ex…
articles.content: Russia is heading back to the Moon as it tries to reassert itself as a significant world power in the wake of its war on Ukraine. A rocket carrying the Luna-25 craft will mark Russias first lunar mis… [+1973 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content: Russia is heading back to the Moon as it tries to reassert itself as a significant world power in the wake of its war on Ukraine.Luna-25 is also in a race against India: the country’s Chandrayaan-3 mission launched on July 14th and entered the Moon’s orbit this week.Russia’s space trip also serves as a salvo in its attempt to reestablish itself as a significant world power unmoved by the West’s sanctions over its 2022 invasion of Ukraine.A rocket carrying the Luna-25 craft will mark Russia’s first lunar mission since 1976.Referencing an era when the Soviet Union was an undeniable world superpower fits with President Vladimir Putin’s goals to project an image of Russian preeminence.The Soyuz 2.1v rocket carrying the lander is scheduled to lift off from the Vostochny spaceport in eastern Russia at 7:10 pm Eastern time.You can tune in to watch the launch here.The Luna-25 will take five days to reach the Moon and is expected to spend five to seven days in orbit before touching down.It includes a scoop that can capture samples up to a depth of 15 cm (six inches) in its hunt for frozen water.The vessel’s name is even a callback to the Soviet Space Program: Its last mission was the Luna-24, which spent 13 days heading to the Moon and back to collect samples in 1976.NASA confirmed in 2020 the discovery of water molecules in sunlit parts of the Moon’s surface.The craft is expected to conduct experiments — using its 68 lbs of research equipment — on the Moon for about a year.You can watch the launch stream below starting at around 7:10 pm EDT.If successful, it would be the first spacecraft to make a soft landing on the Moon’s south pole.That timeline has Russia’s lander potentially reaching the Moon around the same time as India’s, if not slightly ahead.Salvageable water could mark a breakthrough for lunar exploration, providing future human lunar missions with life support, fuel (through extracted hydrogen) and even potential agriculture.The expedition will attempt to land the exploration vehicle on the moon’s south pole, hoping to dig up water ice beneath the surface.India’s craft is scheduled to reach the Moon’s south pole on August 23rd.

articles.paraphrased_content:
If you didn’t take advantage of the pop-up’s Delete old activity link, you can still go back and delete your history.and that “This setting will be paused on all sites, apps, and devices signed in to this account.” It also notes that you are not deleting any of your past data.Assuming you want to completely clean up your YouTube history, select the last.If you’ve been using YouTube on that account at all, you will probably also get a reminder that you already have YouTube history and a link to delete all your old history.Ready?If you’re sure, select Delete.A pop-up will confirm that your data is being deleted and will include a link explaining exactly how (and how fast) your data will be removed.You’ll get a pop-up confirming that you want to delete your history and offering some examples of what will be deleted.YouTube is certainly no exception — in fact, it’s one of the worst offenders — but recently, Google’s video service announced that users now have a choice.If you click that link, you can delete your YouTube history for the past hour, the past day, for all time, or within a custom range.The change in the home feed is being slowly rolled out over the next few months, but it doesn’t hurt to be ready for it.But at least you’ll be ready.You’ll now be on the Activity controls page.Scroll down to YouTube History and click on Turn off.You’ll get a pop-up warning you that by turning off your YouTube history, you won’t get the personalized recommendations, etc.Click on Pause.Now, you’ll get a pop-up informing you that you are no longer saving YouTube history.If you didn’t delete your old activity before, you can do it later on the YouTube History page.Scroll down to YouTube Watch History.After all the pop-ups and warnings, you can finally turn off your YouTube watch history.Many app homepages have gotten incredibly busy, filled with suggestions and ads, many based on your previous searches or stuff you’ve read / written / watched in the past.You’ll probably see a checked circle indicating it is on.If you want to start up your history again, it’s easy — just follow the same path as above to YouTube History and select Turn on.Go back to Your data in YouTube.Scroll down to Manage your YouTube Watch History and select it.Look for the Delete link and select it.When your setting for saving your YouTube memory is finally off, you can delete all your old activity.You have a choice between Delete today, Delete custom range, or Delete all time.You can stop YouTube from saving your watch history with the “Turn off” button.If you turn your watch history off and “have no significant prior watch history,” all that confusion will disappear, and your homepage will only show the search bar and the Shorts, Subscriptions, and Library buttons.Delete your past YouTube history

If you really want to clean up your YouTube page, you do need to delete that history — because otherwise, you’ll still be getting recommendations based on everything you watched before you hit that Pause button.(I was certainly still seeing a lot of recommendations.)According to Google, the changes in YouTube are only being rolled out over the next few months, so it may be a while before you see a change in your YouTube homepage.Here’s how.Click on the arrow.There is a good chance that, despite all this, you would still not see much of a change in your recommendations.Pause your YouTube history

On the YouTube app, click on your profile image in the upper right corner.Select Your data in YouTube.RelatedYouTube will now show a blank homepage if you don’t have watch history on

In other words, you’ll have a clean, simple, easy-on-the-eyes YouTube page.The process is nearly identical for both the web version and mobile versions of YouTube.

NFL RedZone without a cable subscription.Update August 10th, 3:48PM ET: Added that the NFL is developing original content for NFL Plus.We regret the error.However, RedZone will only be available as a perk on the Premium tier.NFL RedZone, the NFL’s excellent whip-around show that jumps from game to game to showcase highlights and key moments as teams are about to score, is coming to the NFL Plus subscription service.NFL Plus launched last year with two tiers: NFL Plus and the more expensive NFL Plus Premium, which added the ability to watch game replays.The NFL is also developing a slate of original content for the service, Jurenka said in the briefing.Both tiers are going up in price: NFL Plus is jumping to $6.99 per month / $49.99 per year, up from $4.99 per month / $39.99 per year, while Premium is bumping up to $14.99 per month / $99.99 per year, up from $9.99 per month / $79.99 per year.NFL is also preparing for another big change: its first season of having NFL Sunday Ticket on YouTube.The Google-owned video platform became the new home of the major broadcasting package, which lets subscribers catch out-of-market Sunday games, after DirecTV’s contract ran out at the end of last season.A key caveat with the service, however, is that you can’t watch live local and primetime regular season and postseason games on anything bigger than a tablet (like your TV), which might and I are playing together and you die, you being the host, then we will both be transported to Umbral.What happens with the souls?Are there any items or upgrades that are unique to New Game Plus?In this case, it's stopping Adyr's return.With PvP, if you're both in the Axiom realm, does the invading player also have two lives?When we're in Axiom, I can use my Umbral lamp and abilities, but I can never bring us both to Umbral.They were supposed not to allow Adyr to come back.The host always directs the realm you are in.Now there's a new god that rules humanity; what happens and what is with these Umbral horror times?Nanite is also great because you get a bump of quality everywhere.We made them actual NPCs in the world, and we wrapped up the story that they had conceived and figured out what happens 1000 years later.So, we have all the information, but we started from a blank slate.But we always had a branch with whatever UE5 pre-launch builds were available.As Saul said, in terms of characters and story events, we took everything that Deck13 did.Why am I doing that?'Cezar Virtosu: No, not entirely.But if you dig into Umbral enough, you will access the heart of it.We kind of made a big kill list of what people liked and what people did not like, the dos and don'ts, right?We just tweaked a couple of things here and there, and then we made it work.You can buy it, though it's a bit expensive when you start, but you can grind for some time, buy it and yes, access that endgame level.We took that, and we went through all the feedback from players, right through Reddit and the Steam community, as well as from reviewers of printed magazines, online magazines, and also YouTube reviews and streamers.Going back on the cosmic horror that you just mentioned.Cezar Virtosu: Yes, we have three endings.Of course, he will keep any items obtained.Cezar Virtosu: The Dark Crusade concept came from our own desire and take on the story.On top of those two, there are other elements, like the Chaos physics, which really helps with all the clothes, and a lot of improvements on animation pipelines that allowed us to make movement more fluid for both enemies and player characters.What is this manifestation?We were keen to jump on the Unreal Engine.The most powerful and, let's say, game-changing technology was Lumen because it allowed us to forego lightmaps, the old-school way to light environments.They would move it, then click render with the towers, and then maybe we went, 'Oh, sorry, I meant three meters, not two'.We moved away from that design because we didn't want the guest to advance the host's world of the host.When you play Lords of the Fallen in co-op, the host interacts with the NPCs, and the guest listens.When the guest comes back to his own world, it did not progress.The invaders will always have the upper hand by virtue of hiding.They're annoying enough that way!Cezar Virtosu: Was your question aimed at the other Lords of the Fallen 2 iterations that were announced previously?They can use the Umbral lamp, which is completely forsaken and forbidden even to talk about, but these guys can use it.

articles.title: Substack wants to make itself a better place for readers, not just writers
articles.description: Substack wants to make the platform a better place for readers and will be adding features to its reading apps so that they “feel increasingly useful and fun,” its co-founders wrote in a post.
articles.content:
Substack wants to make itself a better place for readers, not just writers
Substack wants to make itself a better place for readers, not just writers
 / Substack will be adding features to improve … [+3839 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
The company has already introduced a bunch of features intended to encourage users to hang out on Substack itself instead of just reading individual newsletters that come to their email inbox, including its mobile apps, the ability to add RSS feeds to your Substack feed, and its tweet-like Notes.I guess we’ll see if that happens.While “it has been clear for a while now who a Substack writer is,” the co-founders say, in making these changes, Substack wants to build something that makes people describe themselves as a “Substack reader” (emphasis theirs).And it will all be tied together in a network of meaningful connections—represented by subscriptions—that prioritize trust over time spent or eyeballs captured.You’ll not only have a quiet place to read but also somewhere to hang out with the smartest people you know.(I’d personally recommend reading The Verge!)Substack didn’t immediately reply to a request for comment about further details or a more specific timeline.It’ll be a space where you can establish a home for your cultural interests and build an audience even if you don’t have a publication.We believe in a business model that gives readers the power to help shape culture by directly supporting the writers and work they most value, leading to an incentive system that rewards quality and applies upward pressure for excellence in even the smallest of niches.And this post is Substack sticking its flag in the ground as reading on the internet is in some turmoil.Now that many people are spending less time on Twitter and aren’t so happy with Reddit, there’s an opportunity to establish the next collective internet hangout for text, whether that’s Threads, something involving ActivityPub, or someplace else entirely.Substack wants to make the platform a better place for readers and will be adding features to its reading apps so that they “feel increasingly useful and fun,” co-founders Chris Best, Hamish McKenzie, and Jairaj Sethi said in a post on Thursday.We think that reading can be social without being distracting.Here are some more details — also vague:

Over the coming months and years, we’ll be adding features and evolving our reading apps so that they feel increasingly useful and fun.“The internet revolutionized reading, but instead of a utopia, it has delivered a mess,” the co-founders said.But this attention to Substack readers isn’t a total surprise.And we bet that trusted peer recommendations can drive a discovery system that helps the world’s best readers find the world’s best work—no matter where it comes from.“The main places where we read online today are cacophonic, stressful, and milking our minds for ad dollars.” They acknowledge that there are nice but niche reading products but argue that large tech companies don’t seem interested in making them anymore.“Instead, we are left to contend with a fusillade of pop-ups and a Big Social-dominated media economy that is making us angry and stupid.”

The co-founders, however, think that “it is still possible to harness the internet’s powers to create a better world for readers.” Here are some details about how that might look in practice — though I will warn you that this is somewhat vague:

We can see a future where reading online is a pleasure, with fast-to-load posts, clean and uncluttered pages, and simple navigation.Substack is perhaps best known as a place for writers to build newsletter audiences and make a living from their work, but the co-founders spelled out a vision for how Substack itself can be a better place to actually read things as well.
articles.summary: i’d personally recommend reading the verge

articles.paraphrased_content: But the fact that cross-save is in Baldur’s Gate 3 is making me lose my mind right now in the best possible sense of the words.What a fantastic treat for players that makes purchasing a second copy of the game well worth it when it launches on PS5 on September 6th.And I don’t even mean how it’s a game crafted to appeal to a wide range of players across race, gender, and sexuality.That I can take my BG3 adventures with me on the road?I don’t mean how it’s enjoying incredible success without elements like a battle pass or microtransactions.That I can play from the comfort of my sunroom to enjoy the remaining sunny days of summer?I don’t mean the fact that it’s become the second most played game on Steam right now, catching up to Steam mainstays CS:GO articles.title: Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 review: Bigger, bolder - but not always better
articles.description: Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic is Samsung’s biggest watch yet and the rotating bezel is fun, if unnecessary
articles.content:
Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: One minute review
(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)
Unveiled at Samsung Unpacked 2023, the Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic was overshadowed by those new foldable… [+15193 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
While Samsung doesn't have a studio full of trainers, a la Apple's Fitness Plus, it does offer an on-watch running trainer.You enter details like your height and weight and then awkwardly carefully place your middle and ring fingers against the watch's two buttons without touching your arm.I know I like it but also understand that I don't need it to use the watch.Aside from the size and weight, I enjoyed wearing this smartwatch.To put that in perspective.(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)And about how you compare to the average (Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)This was my first-ever BMI reading.In the first day or so, the Watch barely made it through a day, By the end of a week, it was always at least a day or more, which, as I mentioned earlier made it well-equipped to go from a day of wear to my bed for sleep tracking.It can when you need it to charge quickly on the included charger (adapter not included).I tested it with the new Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5; while it delivers notifications from the phone to the watch, at other times you can start your journey on the watch and have it open on the phone.It's a tough watch, ready to go for a swim and take a drop on the floor.They're all the same as the standard Galaxy Watch 6.Every on-watch action is instantaneous and a pleasure to use.The Always On display is excellent: bright when you lift your hand, but just illuminated enough to read at a glance.Battery life is, in my experience, excellent, as is performance.Both watches can detect when I'm engaged in physical activity, but only the Galaxy Watch would automatically begin tracking the walk without any intervention from me and end it when I stopped, again without me having to tap the screen or hit a button.Throughout the night, I would wake up, feeling the uncomfortable pressure on my wrist, usually because my hand was under my pillow and my head was pressing down on the pillow and the watch underneath.Still, I wore it for a few nights.If you're already wearing a large watch, the Galaxy Watch 6 Classic might be a perfect fit.Design score: 4/5Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: Display(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)Perfectly roundBig and boldSharp, colorful, and brightSamsung fitted the Galaxy Watch 6 Classic with a big, 1.5-inch AMOLED, Always-On display.It's clean, clear, colorful, and makes sense.Plus, it's well-protected under a Sapphire crystal cover.Display score: 4.5/5Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: Software and key featuresSome exercise options, but there's a lot more under "More".I found that, according to the watch, I have 66.6 lbs of muscle, 28.2 lbs of fat mass, and 92.6 pounds of body water, and my BMI is 21.5 which was dead center in the green zone (my body fat was in the lower end of the green zone, yay me).Samsung also enhanced Sleep tracking with deeper info, temperature, and snoring monitoring.Read our full Apple Watch Ultra reviewFirst reviewed: August 2023That impressive battery might be due, in part, to the new Exynos W930 chipset, which might be doing some better power management, even with the giant always-on display.On the curved back are sensors to track your heart, ECG, and temperature.More on this in my software section.Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic new band attachment system (Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)Samsung redesigned the watch band release and now uses an on-band button to retract the pins so you can pull off the band.It also has a barometer, gyroscope, and light sensor.This bold, big-faced WearOS smartwatch is as adept at delivering you the time, weather, and alerts as it is tracking your activities, workouts, and overall health in a way few wearables have attempted before.This is a statement watch that offers a massive 37.3mm screen and the return of the rotatable bezel.(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)When it works, though, you get some fascinating insights.Otherwise, you can choose from among the Galaxy Watch 6's 40 and 43mm sizes (even the smaller 43mm Classic) and spend less and have something lighter, smaller, and less obtrusive on your wrist.The first time, the battery still seemed to be adjusting and it ran out of power before morning.Oddly, it also said I hadn't snored at all.It'll be hard to find a better really-big WearOS smartwatch than this one.Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: SpecificationsSwipe to scroll horizontallyComponentSamsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic (43mm)Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic (47mm)Dimensions42.5 x 42.5 x 10.9 mm46.5 x 46.5 x 10.9 mmWeight52g59gDisplay1.3-inch, 432 x 432 px super AMOLED1.5-inch, 480 x 480 px super AMOLEDCase/BezelStainless steelStainless steelGPSGPS, GLONASS, BEIDOU, GalileoGPS, GLONASS, BEIDOU, GalileoBatteryUp to 40 hoursUp to 40 hoursConnectionBluetooth 5.3, Wi-Fi, LTEBluetooth 5.3, Wi-Fi, LTEWater-resistant5ATM+IP685ATM+IP68Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: Price and availability(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)The Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic debuted during Samsung Unpacked on July 26, alongside the Watch 6, the Tab S9 series, the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5, and the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 5 phones.In the US, we have prices for the Bluetooth-only Watch 6 Classic models, which costs $399.99 for the 43mm model, and $429.99 for the 47mm model.This is so it can send a low-power electrical current through your body to measure your bone, fat and muscle mass, just like one of the best smart scales.the smaller 40mm Galaxy Watch 6 weighs just 28.7g, and for comparison, the 45mm Apple Watch 8 weighs 51.5g with GPS and cellular support.It can track your activity, heartbeat, ECG, and temperature, and analyze your body composition and sleep habits, although good luck wearing such an obtrusive watch in your sleep.Now our knurled, rotatable friend is back, and it has control of the watch features.By the third night, I had everything in place, it got my light, deep, and REM sleep, my blood oxygen levels which vary widely through the night, and even my temperature range.You can turn it counterclockwise to see notifications or the right to access key watch features like exercise modes.The 47mm size costs £399 for Bluetooth-only and £459 for the LTE-capable watch.Australian Samsung users can expect to pay AU$699 for the 43mm Bluetooth-only watch, AU$799 for a 43mm LTE-capable model, AU$749 for 47mm Bluetooth-only option, and AU $849 for a 47mm LTE-capable watch.I found the button a bit confusing because there's no physical indication that you can freely remove the band, you just have to press and pull.It's full of useful fitness and health features and did a nice job of managing my notifications.Then there's the bezel.Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: ScorecardSwipe to scroll horizontallySamsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: ScorecardCategoryCommentScoreValueA good price for all you get4/5DesignAttractive but big and heavy4/5DisplayLarge, round and gorgeous4.5/5Software and FeaturesGreat interface and a ton of useful features across information, health, and fitness4.5/5Performance and BatteryFast, responsive and great battery life5/5Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: Should I buy?Buy it if...You're into tracking all aspects of your health
This watch covers all the health-tracking basics plus a whole lot more.You like a classic look
The Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic has old-school analog watch looks, and the bezel is fun and can be useful.You want the biggest watch
47 mm is a monster smartwatch with a very big screen.Don't buy it if...You have small or sensitive wrists
This is a big, fat, heavy smartwatch.You're on a budget
You can get all the same features (even the same battery life) with a smaller, cheaper Galaxy Watch 6.Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: Also considerGarmin Fenix 7 Pro
The same great watch but slightly cheaper, without the improved AMOLED screen.Subtlety is discarded for a readable-at-a-distance watch face and an aggressive design.Separating the watch's two main, customizable buttons, for example, is an island of metal that serves no functional purpose but is clearly a callback to watch designs of old.The second time, it effectively tracked all my sleeping patterns (I have so little deep sleep) but I forgot my phone, so it missed my snoring.Battery life improved over a series of days to the point where I could finally wear it, sleep with it, and then keep wearing it the next day without having to charge it until midday.(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)There's also passive activity tracking that looks at steps, time spent, and calories burned.Instead of closing rings as you do on an Apple Watch, you're closing colorful heart-shaped bands.The touch screen lets you swipe through modes, apps, and notifications.The round screen is beautiful to look at and quite sharp thanks to a 480x480 resolution, which, in one way, beats our Apple Watch 8's 396 by 484 pixels.As a touch screen, it's fast and responsive.I had no trouble navigating to find my information, track my activities, or read and react to notifications.Even though a lot of smartwatch designs started as variations of traditional watch themes including crowns and complications, they have over time moved away from that.This is about a love of big watches and the enjoyment of other people noticing the big, bright smartwatch on your wrist.Samsung has packed the 59g (the 43mm Classic weighs just 33.3g) with features and sensors.Remember, all the prices above are for the Watch 6 Classic: for the standard Watch 6 prices, you'll need to check out our Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 review.I wore both the Apple Watch 8 and Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 classic whenever I went for a walk.(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)Improved Sleep featuresCustom WorkoutsComprehensive heart health informationWhile email, meeting, weather, and other app notifications are table stakes for most smartwatches, companies like Samsung are still innovating on wearable health, wellness, and fitness features.Sometimes, it didn't work, and the watch recommended I moisturize my fingers.Image 1 of 5Getting a BMI reading from the Galaxy Watch 6 Classic (Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)It can tell you a lot about yourbody.The action of turning the physical rotating dial does the same thing.You don't buy the large Samsung Galaxy 6 Classic for extra features or even more battery life.I can also use Samsung's rich Wear app to manage all my watch's settings and features, including choosing from among an extensive collection of watch faces that include graphical and animated treatments, faces devoted to health and information, your photos, and classic watch style faces.I'm not a great sleeper and the watch knows it.Value score: 4/5Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: Design(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)Larger 47mm sizesRotating bezel looks greatStylish and boldI have drawers full of classic analog, windup watches, and the Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic would look at home next to any of them.I have not done the sleep tracking often enough to acquire a sleep animal designation from Samsung.The latter, though, requires you to keep your phone nearby as it uses those mics to pick up the snoring sounds.To be clear, I hate wearing watches to track my sleep habits, None of them are comfortable but the 47mm Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic is a true edge case.Early Samsung smartwatches had it but it was gone in Galaxy Watch 5.I didn't go climbing but did dunk the smartwatch in some water, after which it was no worse for the wear.Design-wise, this is a watch to get you noticed.My wife often complains about my snoring, so I find this surprising.This is a big watch, measuring 47mm: 46.5 x 46.5 x 10.9 mm, and weighing 59g.Not sure why I would care about that anyway.I did use the watch to check my ECG, which always came up normal, and to see my heart rate hold steady in the low 60s.Overall, I really like the WearOS 4, OneUI 5 interface.The process is called bioelectric impedance analysis, and it's awkward but works.Otherwise, it's a perfect companion for your best Samsung Galaxy Phone.More importantly, the mobile CPU seems to manage the watch's processing needs while not sapping battery life.Samsung rates the watch for up to 30-hour battery life with the Always On display on.The watch guides you to stay still and extend your arms so your armpits are open.The LTE-enabled watches, which do not require a smartphone to access the internet, cost a little extra: $449.99 for the 43mm model, and $479.99 for the 47mm.In the UK, prices start at £369 for the Bluetooth-only 43mm model and £429 for the 43mm LTE option.For my free weights, pushups, and pullups, I tended to use "other."(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)Software and features score: 4.5/5Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: Performance and battery life(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)The Samsung Galaxy Watch Classic 6's new Exynos W930 dual-core 1.4GHz processor is more than enough juice for this wearable.As an old-school watch collector, I love the look of the bezel, even as I acknowledge that there is no practical reason for it to exist.It certainly makes it a good performer, as the watch is peppy and responsive.I don't love the size but that may be a personal preference.Once inside each feature, the bezel can walk you through app controls and settings.(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)Performance and battery life score: 5/5Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: verdictIf you want everything the Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 offers but in a much bigger and maybe more traditional-looking package, the 47 mm Galaxy Watch 6 Classic is for you.I know, it's all a bit weird.Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic: One minute review(Image credit: Future / Lance Ulanoff)Unveiled at Samsung Unpacked 2023, the Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic was overshadowed by those new foldables (the Galaxy Z Fold 5 and Galaxy Z Flip 5) and probably didn't get all the love it deserves.I'm not a runner, so I didn't try this out.Some activity and health-tracking options.With it off, it jumps to a rated 40 hours.On the fitness front, Samsung manages to be somewhat more proactive than Apple.I loved this.Samsung has most of the fitness routines covered including running, walking, cycling, hiking, swimming (indoor and out), treadmill, exercise bike, circuit training, weight machines, and other.Like the Apple Watch, the Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic (and its siblings) will remind you to stand up and get moving and will cheer you when you've done so.The watch can even assess your body composition, which is something I've never done before.The Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 Classic is packed with features that track all manner of your physical well-being.You can check out our Samsung Galaxy Watch 6 vs Apple Watch 8 comparison piece for more info there.With IP68 and military-spec ratings for withstanding dips, shocks, drops, and wide temperature variations, the smartwatch is ready for a dive (50 meters for 10 minutes) and a climb up your nearest mountain.In my testing, early disappointment gave way to satisfaction and eventually glee.All of them share the same features and battery life, so the choice ultimately comes down to fashion and the flexibility of your pocketbook.For some, the rotating bezel is a defining and desirable feature.Read our full Garmin Fenix 7 Pro reviewApple Watch Ultra
Apple's offering to the outdoor watch space is incredible in every way, apart from that lower battery life.Even Samsung's baseline Galaxy Watch 6 has shed many of the analog watch accouterments in favor of sleek clean lines and a perfectly flat watch face.The Galaxy Watch 6 Classic, though, goes in a different direction, adopting the retro look of a beefy analog windup.

articles.author: Justine Calma
articles.title: Is that viral ‘superconductor’ legit?
articles.description: The discovery of LK-99 kicked off a frenzy when researchers claimed it was the world’s first room-temperature superconductor. But new research this week dashes hopes about LK-99’s potential.
articles.content:
Is that viral superconductor legit?
Is that viral superconductor legit?
 / A newly discovered material called LK-99 kicked off a frenzy to see if it really was a game-changing superconductor. The r… [+4956 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
Speculation that it could bring on a perfect power grid or easily make trains levitate sparked a frenzy to test whether LK-99 really was as game-changing as portrayed by the original team.That saves a lot of energy from being lost and also makes for powerful electromagnets.But there are already well over a dozen papers on ArXiv casting doubt on LK-99.There are other superconductors used today in quantum computers and MRI machines.That happens with superconductors because they expel a magnetic field through a phenomenon called the Meissner effect.What made LK-99 so exciting initially was the prospect of having a new superconductor that could work at room temperature and under ambient pressure.But they only work in extremely cold temperatures (hundreds of degrees below zero Fahrenheit) or under very high pressures.LK-99 hasn’t turned out to be the miraculous superconductor some people initially claimed it was.Proving whether LK-99 was the real deal depended on whether other researchers could replicate the Korean researchers’ results.It is a very highly resistive poor quality material.No point in fighting with the truth,” the University of Maryland’s Condensed Matter Theory Center (CMTC) posted on August 7th.Prestigious research labs across the globe took on the task, as did enthusiastic amateurs caught up in a wave of viral social media posts about LK-99.Some people livestreamed their efforts on Twitch.“With a great deal of sadness, we now believe that the game is over.There were inconsistencies in data they published, and many outside experts had their doubts from the start.“There is no sign of superconductivity in LK-99 at room temperature,” says one preprint from the CSIR-National Physical Laboratory in India.Having a superconductor that can be used in more normal conditions would open up all kinds of possibilities, ranging from improving existing technologies, like more powerful medical imaging machines, to potentially bringing moonshot technologies like nuclear fusion reactors within reach.Period.A slew of research groups have released studies that counter claims originally made about LK-99.Another popular video on social media showed another shard of LK-99, made by a research team from Huazhong University of Science and Technology, appearing to levitate.That means it can be magnetized and then attracted or repelled by other magnetic materials (iron, for example, is ferromagnetic).The researchers who discovered it shared a video of a fragment of the material appearing to partially levitate over a magnet.“No point in fighting with the truth.”

A superconductor is any material that can conduct electricity with zero resistance (The Verge has a more in-depth explainer here).The newly discovered material made headlines after a research team claimed it was the first room-temperature superconductor, which could revolutionize our energy system.The Quantum Energy Research Centre in South Korea, which published the paper, did not respond to requests for comment.That keeps them from being deployed more widely in ways that could potentially change daily life.But hopes that levitation meant that LK-99 is a superconductor were dashed this week after another preprint posed another explanation for why the material might float.(That was one of the papers cited by the University of Maryland’s Condensed Matter Theory Center this week when it posted that “the game is over.”)

Another crucial test for LK-99 was over its ability to levitate.LK99 is NOT a superconductor, not even at room temperatures (or at very low temperatures).RelatedThe LK-99 ‘superconductor’ went viral — here’s what the experts think

Now, a body of evidence has piled up that disproves claims about LK-99.“There may be room temperature superconductors to find, but this does not seem to be one,” Chris Grovenor, professor of materials at the University of Oxford and director of the Centre for Applied Superconductivity, tells The Verge in an email.The International Center for Quantum Materials in China found evidence that the material is ferromagnetic.Some big-name labs, like the US Department of Energy’s Argonne National Laboratory, have yet to share their findings.“We believe that our new development will be a brand-new historical event that opens a new era for humankind,” researchers who discovered the LK-99 wrote in a now controversial paper they published in late July without peer review.They set out to make samples of the material and test it themselves.Labs hurriedly published their own results on ArXiv, the same server for preprints (papers that haven’t undergone peer review) where the original papers on LK-99 first appeared.But the results so far indicate that LK-99 is not a superconductor, at room temperature or otherwise.

articles.author: Ash Parrish
articles.title: Overwatch 2 needs a win — the Invasion event, at best, is a draw
articles.description: There’s hope that the game’s new story missions and game type will win back fans disappointed by PvE’s cancellation.
articles.content:
Image: Blizzard

 


 There’s hope that the game’s new story missions and game type will win back fans disappointed by PvE’s cancellation. Overwatch 2’s Invasion event, which goes live today, is the… [+10634 chars]
articles.paraphrased_content:
But even with that low bar, Push seemingly hasn’t really succeeded in the court of player opinion.We’ve heard Lúcio and Reinhardt share tons of cute moments talking to each other in spawn rooms, but because they haven’t officially met in the game’s canon, when they do in the Rio mission, they don’t know each other at all, and it feels jarring.That’s not wholly bad, as it means that we finally have the chance to see things we’ve only heard referenced in voice lines — like the contentious relationship between Zenyatta and Ramattra — directly addressed and enshrined in canon.Her presence in a match is much more pronounced than other healers because she’s so offensively stacked in addition to her healing.Since I’m a support main, I chose Brigitte, and I hated her.I’ve long been the kind of player who values story over all other elements in a game.To be clear, the story missions aren’t bad!Firstly, my experience in early access was just custom games filled with bots and is, therefore, not really representative of what live matches will feel like.I have a unique and complicated relationship with Overwatch.But I held out, believing that losing whatever PvE was going to be would be okay because I was still getting story missions.Not so much anymore.She’s a powerful, offensive healer who didn’t feel intimidating to learn like Lifeweaver was.She’s got lil’ cucumbers under her eyes!I love the idea of Overwatch, but the game itself?Image: Blizzard

Illari feels similar to but much more powerful than Moira offensively and with respect to her healing output.Because of seven years of essentially no story that wasn’t just flashbacks, the game has to officially and explicitly state information that we, as players, have already come to understand.As a support main, I’m generally good at keeping other people healed, but I tend to neglect my own health bar.I want to see their relationships develop.Now, is that because using it netted me a triple kill, winning me play of the game, which is exceedingly rare but very prestigious for a support player?So while my role is vital, it typically goes uncelebrated in a match in favor of the big team wipes tanks and damage heroes do.If one team gets an early lead, it’s really difficult for the opposing team to make a comeback, leading to demoralizing blowouts.The event, which coincides with season 6 of the battle pass, offers a new hero, a new game mode, and, perhaps most importantly, new story missions that, for the first time, advance Overwatch’s story.Also, Illari’s llama pajama skin is so stinkin’ cute, giving me yet another reason to love her.I really enjoyed how, in the Rio mission, you had to fight against a huge boss robot that required a bit of actual strategy to defeat beyond just shooting it in the face.But because those conversations happened in the primordial vacuum of the spawn room, they aren’t canon.So while Flashpoint’s been in development for a while, its addition to the game comes at a time when it feels like it’s meant to respond to the disappointment surrounding Push.To reiterate, I don’t think any of Invasion’s many new offerings are bad or of poor quality.Flashpoint’s high…er point, though, was playing as the new support hero, Illari.Winston, in the face of the danger posed by the evil shadow organization Talon and a brewing robot uprising, sends up a beacon to rally former Overwatch operatives to combat these looming threats.Remixing is actually a big theme for the story missions, as each is essentially a remixed version of a typical Overwatch game type with some extra bells and whistles.We’ve already seen how these characters interact with each other from the voice lines we hear at the start of each match.In addition to her secondary fire being a direct healing beam, Illari can also place a powerful healing turret anywhere on the battlefield.The first team to three points wins.If you enjoy Overwatch and don’t have the kind of emotional investment I have in the game, then this will be a great addition — if you can stomach the price tag.Now, with the Invasion event and its three story missions, we get to see the events that happen immediately after Winston gets the gang back together.The missions’ story elements, however, are just okay.And, of course, it’s always gonna feel good to transform into his turret mode to mow down enemies as a sentient minigun.From cinematics, we already know Reinhardt hates omnics.But with Flashpoint’s simplicity and its similarity to an existing game type, it doesn’t work for me.Deploying her shield and swinging her flail around just didn’t jive with my style of play, and I was having a crappy time playing the mission.In Overwatch 2, Bastion’s old self-healing ability has changed to a sticky grenade launcher that I had no problem managing.Not so with Illari.Teams fight to control one of five points spread out equally on maps that are the largest in the game.But before we get there, we have to wait for the game to catch up with all the world-building.There are other elements to the missions that introduce variety and prevent them from being straight-up story-driven reskins of Overwatch matches.Image: Blizzard

The missions’ story elements, however, are just okay.That’s… all I can really say about it, as it doesn’t feel productive describing what it feels like to play.That’s unfortunate because I return to this game over and over, specifically because of the characters.It is so special to me as a person and a journalist that I hoped adding the one thing I care about the most would be enough to win me back.From his older voice lines, we also already know that he’s working on that prejudice.On a whim, I changed to Bastion, and my entire outlook transformed.But the game has to explicitly spell all that out because it hasn’t officially been able to until this point.The story missions take place either in totally new locations like Gothenburg or in places familiar to players but have been remixed into an entirely new map like Toronto and Rio de Janeiro.With precise placement, Illari can keep her team healthy in the middle of an intense fight while also putting out enough damage to turn the tide of battle.I had hoped the missions would offer me some new nugget to latch onto, and it didn’t.That feels bad to say that because I don’t know what more is, and it seems unfair to ask for more from a development team that’s been through and done so much already.I didn’t think I’d like that aspect because I have my roster of comfort heroes, and I stick with them.They need something more.But for Gothenburg, I was forced to pick from a slate of characters I never use.In Toronto, your team has to defend locations and prevent them from being overrun by hostiles, kind of like playing a Control match.Overwatch 2’s Invasion event, which goes live today, is the game’s biggest update since penciling in the “2” in October of last year.Though these missions are brand new and put characters in new situations with new people they are meeting for the first time, I didn’t really feel like the story itself was doing anything new, especially with respect to the characters.But let’s not split hairs here.The Gothenburg mission also has a fun, if frustrating at higher difficulties, tower defense moment in which you deploy and repair turrets to assist in protecting a giant cannon.Secondly, it’s just the control game type on a much larger map.After all these years and being set in my ways, I appreciated that Overwatch still had some surprises for me in unlikely hero choices.I love the idea of Overwatch, but the game itself?And while I appreciate and enjoy all the new coming to Overwatch 2, I can’t shake the feeling that this all feels too little and too late.But when it’s time to actually play the game, I balk and look elsewhere for entertainment.The characters have been Overwatch’s one shining highlight in the midst of its sad-to-watch decline.But as we know, PvE isn’t happening anymore.Seven years later, the “Zero Hour” animated short that arrived with Overwatch 2 shows some of those heroes finally answering that call.Image: Blizzard

Flashpoint is Overwatch 2’s newest game type after Push was introduced at the game’s launch as a replacement for the Assault game type.Flashpoint is Overwatch 2’s newest game mode.In the story missions, you don’t have access to Overwatch 2’s full roster; you’re instead made to choose between a handful of characters that are present for that particular part of the story.So when PvE was announced, I was jazzed because I love this game so much.Her ultimate, Captive Sun, which lets me fire these big concussive shots that not only slowed my enemies but also made them explode, is my favorite ultimate in the game.A lot of lapsed players like myself pinned their hopes on PvE, and when that went away, their hope for the game died with it.I love what the developers have done with the game’s characters, story, and its overall aesthetic.Instead of fighting for control of one point, resetting, and fighting again, you do all that on the same map — no resets.Sure.Not so much anymore.Image: Blizzard

The Invasion event also has three story missions, which are meant to essentially restart Overwatch’s story that began with the “Recall” animated short released in 2016.But now that they’re here, I’ve come too late to the realization that story missions just aren’t enough.But three 20–30 minute missions that essentially repackage the typical Overwatch quick play experience in admittedly gorgeous, new locations is a tough buy for someone looking to fall in love with the game again, especially since you have to pay an extra $15 for it.These missions are square one for Overwatch’s story, so they’ve become square one for the characters, too.The Rio de Janeiro mission reminds me of Deathmatch, requiring players to simply kill everything that moves, and in Gothenburg, you escort a payload.His kit has changed significantly between original Overwatch and now for the better.I’m a support main — my job is making sure my teammates don’t die.Because Assault was unfairly reviled, Push didn’t have to be much to make players happy again.In Gothenburg, your job is payload.They’re actually a pleasant, if ho-hum, experience, exacerbated by the fact I was playing with bots.I played Lúcio in the Rio mission and Baptiste in Toronto.I want those interactions.Each point unlocks sequentially, and once a team reaches 100 percent control, the next point unlocks.New Junk City is one of the two Flashpoint maps coming with season 6.

While perfectly reasonable, the change went largely unannounced, and existing users committing themselves to the open-source project may not be aware without reading the small print.Read more> These are the best identity theft protection tools

> The EU’s Product Liability Directive could kill open source

> Many open-source software components have worrying security risksThe SponsorLink DLLs, which collect hashes of email addresses to send to SponsorLink's CDN, contain obfuscated code that goes against Moq’s open-source principles.In the days that followed the update, GitHub became awash with criticism of the move, with many disgruntled users calling the update a GDPR breach.One user called the move a “moqery.”In light of the backlash, Cazzulino has confirmed that “the actual email is never sent when performing the sponsoring check,” which can be verified by “running Fiddler to see what kind of traffic is happening.”Cazzulino continues: “The email on your local machine is hashed with SHA256, then Base62-encoded.Popular open source (OS) project Moq just got updated to include a not-so-open-source addition in the form of a series of DLLs designed to collect hashes of user email addresses.The changes were first reported on by BleepingComputer, which notes that the project sees around 100,000 daily downloads on average, having amassed more than 476 million since its inception.From version 4.20.0, Moq started including SponsorLink, a project shipped as closed-source that takes away from one of Moq’s key benefits - the fact that it’s an OS project.Moq bundles in a closed-source projectOne of Moq’s owners, Daniel Cazzulino, noted by BleepingComputer to also be a maintainer of the SponsorLink project, quietly pushed the update earlier this month.The resulting opaque string (which can never reveal the originating email) is the only thing used.”Furthermore, suspending or uninstalling the app deletes all records associated with a user’s account.In a further update, version 4.20.2 looks to have reversed the change, though for many, the reputational damage could have been enough to put them off.Check out a list of our best business VPN services for extra privacyOthers pointed out that an obfuscated package could potentially hide some activity from unaware users.

articles.paraphrased_content:
“The FEC has unanimously asked it to revisit that choice and to grant us broader authority to punish fraud by campaigns, but as is Congress’ right, it has chosen to ignore that request.”

Thursday’s vote comes after a flurry of action from both Congress and the White House to regulate AI.“It would be news to many, I suspect, to learn that the FEC may police candidates telling lies about their opponents.In April, the RNC released an AI-generated ad in response to President Joe Biden’s election announcement, painting a dystopian version of the future if he won reelection.The petition, filed by the advocacy group Public Citizen, calls on the commission to leverage its authority to punish fraud by creating rules banning candidates and political parties from using AI to misrepresent their opponents.The White House also secured a handful of voluntary commitments from some of the top AI companies, like Altman’s company, to develop the technology responsibly.After weeks of back and forth, the Federal Election Commission decided that it will, maybe, make rules regulating the use of AI-generated content in political ads.But Congress has dragged its feet on approving any rules regulating tech despite the wave of hearings, legislation, and heated statements they’ve released in recent years.“The FEC’s decision to proceed with a public comment period is an encouraging sign that the threat AI poses to our democracy may finally be taken seriously.”

Republican Commissioner Allen Dickerson opposed the petition when it was first filed earlier this summer but voted to start the commenting period on Thursday.“AI is increasingly being used to generate misleading content that can be used against candidates regardless of party,” Klobuchar said in a statement to The Verge.The Democratic National Committee and the RNC have declined to comment on whether they’d issue internal rules around AI’s use in the past.Rep. Yvette Clarke (D-NY) was the first to put out a bill requiring campaigns and political groups to disclose when they include AI-generated content in ads.In May, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee, saying that lawmakers should quickly pass new rules regulating the industry and specifically asking for a government licensing program.Never Back Down used AI to mimic former President Donald Trump’s voice in an ad last month.These attack videos have migrated to social platforms that have similarly loose rules.At an open meeting Thursday, the FEC voted to open up the petition for public comment, kicking off a process that could result in new rules governing how campaigns use AI going into effect before the end of the year.That was Congress’ choice,” Dickerson said during Thursday’s meeting.I plan to introduce bipartisan legislation to make the FEC’s authority to deal with this clear, whether they already have the authority or not.”

Once the petition hits the federal register, the public will have 60 days to comment.Still, Dickerson questioned whether the FEC has the necessary authority to implement the requested rules, suggesting that Public Citizen and others should be demanding federal lawmakers take action first.The plan asks lawmakers to address a variety of risks associated with AI, from national security and job loss to copyright and misinformation.Meanwhile, political groups like the Republican National Committee and Never Back Down, a Ron DeSantis super PAC, have already started using the tech.“Will will also need Congress to act on banning across the board or requiring disclosure across the board in other spaces that campaign ads are being generated.”

After Thursday’s vote, Klobuchar said that she would be introducing a new bill to increase the FEC’s authority over AI.While Congress has made clear its intent to put up rules around the technology, few actual bills have been introduced.In June, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) put out a plan for how Congress should approach regulating the industry called the SAFE Innovation Framework.With the 2024 elections approaching, Gilbert and Public Citizen issued their petition as a means of getting some rules on the books before campaign season takes off in full force.In June, the DeSantis campaign shared a video containing fake images of Trump kissing Anthony Fauci, a former White House chief medical advisor who led the US’s response to covid-19.Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-MN) has introduced a companion to Clark’s measure in the Senate.“This is one piece of the solution,” Gilbert said in an interview with The Verge on Wednesday.“While today’s decision is a step forward, we need the FEC to act now.“The need to regulate deepfakes and other deceptive uses of AI in election ads becomes more urgent with each passing day”

“The need to regulate deepfakes and other deceptive uses of AI in election ads becomes more urgent with each passing day,” Lisa Gilbert, Public Citizen executive vice president, said in a statement Thursday.

articles.paraphrased_content: From the screenshots and trailer released today, developer id Software looks like it’s stuck pretty close to the 1997 original for its remaster.There’s also an FAQ and suite of accessibility options, including a handy guide to help players get the most out of the game.But although Quake II RTX still looks stunning by any measure, it’s only playable on a adds another 28 campaign levels, a deathmatch level, and a new story pitting players against a machine that threatens the very fabric of reality.But the remaster is packed with modern conveniences, including cloud saves, 4K Ultra HD resolution, and split-screen local and online co-op / multiplayer.It’s available as part of a Game Pass subscription if you have one, and if you already owned Quake II via the Microsoft Store, Steam, or Good Old Games (GOG), the new version should be available as a free update.The new remaster, meanwhile, is available across basically every current and last-gen system.This Quake II release is beefy, as it includes both original mission packs, “The Reckoning” and “Ground Zero,” which add a combined total of 33 campaign levels and 21 deathmatch maps.Two years after the surprise announcement and release of a remastered version of the original Quake, Quake II is getting a similar glow-up to coincide with the start of QuakeCon.“Enjoy Quake II’s legendary gameplay, preserved and complete with the original soundtrack by Sonic Mayhem, now enhanced with widescreen support, restored content previously left on the cutting room floor, visual and performance upgrades to make every muzzle flash and gib-plosion pop on-screen and even new levels,” Bethesda wrote in the press release announcing Quake II.Its remaster, which is simply titled Quake II, is available today for $9.99 for PC, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, and PlayStation.This multiplatform Quake II remaster comes just a few short years after Nvidia released a ray-traced version of the game in 2019 to showcase its then-fancy new RTX technology.
